012797-d-01-27-97-APA.Narrative: PRIOR TO ARRIVING AT MILE POST 16 WHERE A CUT WAS TO BE MADE, THE CONDUCTOR AND ENGINEER AGREED TO SAVE OR "BOTTLE" THE AIR.  UPON ARRIVING AT POINT OF CUT OUT, BRAKEMAN DETRAINED ON FIREMAN'S SIDE OFCONSIST.  HE WALKED TO THE SWITCH PREPARING TO THROW IT AT APPROPRIATE TIME.  THE CONDUCTOR DETRAINED ON THE ENGINEER'S SIDE OF THE CONSIST.  AFTER 25 LB. REDUCTION OF AIR ENGINEER GAVE BLAST OF WHISTLE.  CONDUCTOR THEN CLOSED ANGLE COCK BETWEEN 5TH & 6TH CARS.  CONDUCTOR TOLD ENGINEER TO TAKE THEMAHEAD AFTER BOARDING THE TRAILING CAR.  AFTER CLEARING SWITCH POINT, BRAKEMAN THREW THE SWITCH, NOWPOSITIONED TO ROLL CAR TO SET OUT TRACK CONDUCTOR CLOSED ANGLE COCKS ON 4TH & 5TH CARS.  BEING POSITIONED ON BRAKE PLATFORM LIFTING THE OPERATING LEVER THE CAR ROLLED ONTO SET OUT TRACK UNASSISTED.CONDUCTOR TIGHTENED HAND BRAKE THEN OPENED ANGLE COCK.  BRAKEMAN WAS GIVING RADIO SIGNALS TO ENGINEER TO RECONNECT TO CUT OF CARS WHEN IT WAS DISCOVERED THAT THE CUT OF CARS WAS MISSING.  THE CUT OF CARS CONSISTING OF 73 FREIGHT CARS WAS ROLLING BACK NORTH.  AFTER PURSUING CARS FOR SOME DISTANCE ANDUNABLE TO CATCH THEM CREW TELEPHONED 911 EMERGENCY NUMBER REPORTING A RUNAWAY TRAIN.  AT MILE POST1.7 THERE IS A 6 DEGREE RIGHT-HAND CURVE WHERE THE CUT OF CARS TRAVELING AT AN ESTIMATED SPEED OF 70MPH DERAILED.  NORMAL TRAIN SPEED FOR THIS AREA IS 22 MPH. DE0197478-d-01-23-97-DMVW.Narrative: HEAD AND WEB SEPARATION STARTED CHAIN REACTION.  UNDER THE FIRST LOCOMOTIVE HEAD AND WEB BROKE OUT,THIS ALSO BROKE JOINT BARS AT SAME TIME OR SHORTLY AFTER.
